title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 200.3 - Papers filed in a criminal court; form
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 200.3 - Papers filed in a criminal court; form

State Regulations

In addition to complying with the applicable
provisions of CPLR 2101, every paper filed in court, other than an exhibit or
printed form, shall contain writing on one side only, and if typewritten, shall
have at least double space between each line, except for quotations and the
names and addresses of attorneys appearing in the action, and shall have at
least one-inch margins. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
200.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
